about.name: Karl-Johan Westhoff
about.title: Engineer
about.summary: Experienced engineer with 15+ years of expertise designing safe and secure ocean structures and developing software tools to power engineering solutions. I have extensive experience as project manager for client facing and technically challenging projects of various size.
offerings: Experience from the worlds largest infrastructure projects in teh O&G industry
Desire to optimize processes and the capabilities to actually plug in and energize digitalization

learnings.learned: Even if you have the best crew, only one mistake at the helm can mess everything up, being at the wheel comes with obligations
Tenacity! And to appreciate that every effort you put into training pays off (p.b. 10:31hrs on the IM distance)
Appreciate all the help you can get, competent professionals are worth it

interests: Camping and hiking in beautiful USA with my family
The opportunity to train our awesome border-collie
Experience and learn new things (i have recently build an IOT connected plant watering system)

company.name: National Oilwell Varco (NOV, Flexibles)
company.description: NOV delivers highly engineered flexible pipe systems for the biggest companies in the offshore oil and gas industry

workexperience.title: Senior Engineer, Software Development (Remote)
tasks: Working remote, developing in house web based project management tool.
learnings: Learned a lot about building and delivering software in a corporate context

workexperience.title: Senior Engineer, System Assessment Services
tasks: Project management responsibility for large front end engineering design (FEED) projects ( ~1000-3500 engineering hrs. up to 250.000$) bringing new technology to market and pushing boundaries for flexible risers.
System assessment engineer and project manager responsible for the technical and commercial execution of client facing service projects in the offshore oil and gas industry.
Planning and execution of off-site technical engineering campaign in the Caucasus area, including handling import/export of materials and personnel, and strategy for health and safety (HSE).

Engineering during sales phase and tactical on-site management for a engineering procurement construction and installation (EPCI) project delivering a ship to shore on/off loading system in West Africa.
learnings: Learned being a leader and how get the best people to drive your project

workexperience.title: Senior Engineer, Pipe System Design
tasks: Design engineer, designing flexible pipe and riser systems
Deliver design reports and documentation on time
Handle client communication on technical engineering subjects
Build software skills developing a multitude of engineering design tools.
learnings: Processes, and that these need constant improvements
Learned to pass on knowledge and inspire others

workexperience.title: Design Engineer, Pipe Design
tasks: Design flexible pipes for the toughest offshore conditions, worldwide
Participate in technical meetings with clients
learnings: Learned how to play a part in the much bigger context of a offshore O&G project

company.name: Lloyds Register / Odegaard & Danneskiold-Samsoe
company.description: Odegaard & Danneskold-Sams√∏e (ODS) carried out Engineering consultancy within fluid dynamics, noise and vibration. ODS was acquired by Lloyds Register in 2005

workexperience.title: Consultant, Marine
tasks: Finite Element (FEA) calculations of strength and vibration of ships
Field measurement work, acoustics and structural vibration
learnings: Learned working independently, responsibility and to make things work

workexperience.title: Student Assistant
tasks: Continuing an internship I worked in the ship design department, carrying out 3d-modelling and CAD workshop drawings.

education.title: Master of Information and Cybersecurity
education.description: UC Berkeley Graduate Programme, world class Instructors

education.title: Graduate Certificate in Applied Data Science
education.description: UC Berkeley Graduate Certificate, world class Instructors

education.title: M.Sc. Mechanical Engineering
education.description: Thesis work at DTU, Blast Performance of CFRP Composites: The project was carried out in cooperation with the Danish Defense Research Establishment (now a part of (FMT) and Falck-Schmidt Defense System. The project dealt with carbon fiber composite materials subjected to high explosives and included numerical modelling and design of and execution of blast experiments.

education.title: B.Sc. Naval Architecture and Marine Engineering

volunteering.item: Voluneering in my son's 1st, 2'nd and 3'rd grade

items.title: Project Planning
items.description: I am used to the rigorous planning, constant updates and constant coordination required to succeed in the huge infrastructure projects of the Oil and Gas industry, including agile short term task planning using PDCA lean boards etc. to full fledged Gantt charted projects which are to interface with the largest infrastructure projects in the world.

items.title: Risk Analyses
items.description: Risk analyses is a part of everything in the Oil and Gas industry both regarding financial risks and the risk for life. I am used to adhering  to the stringiest requirements and carrying out risk management at all levels including everything from strategic risk analyses/planning over HIRA's to Toolbox talks in fhe field. I like the oil and gas industry for this particular reason -always think safety, it is your loved ones who will suffer if you are injured

items.title: Engineering Studies
items.description: Extensive experience as project manager for Front End Engineering Design projects carried out for major global energy companies, every thing from lifetime extension of assets over evaluation of exceeded parameters to full forensics of failed equipments and root cause analyses there of

items.title: Client Services
items.description: Management of a plethora of Client focused technical assistance with inputs from many engineering disciplines, keeping our clients operations running safely

items.title: FEED
items.description: Extensive experience as project manager for Front End Engineering Design projects, carried out for major global energy companies, scopes typically ranging 1000-5000 engineering hours.

items.title: Offshore Oil and Gas Industry
items.description: 10+ yas in the flexible pipe industry making big and awesome structures, adhering to the second-to-none requirements and standards for safety in oil & gas industry. I have worked with submerged structured, both in the water column and on seabed

items.title: Ships Structures
items.description: Calculating strains and stresses of floating structures subjected to wave loads, and producing engineering designs adhering to class standards

items.title: Sub Sea Structures
items.description: Most of the engineering i have worked on is below the water surface, either in the water column connecting surface to seabed or resting on the seafloor

items.title: Shock and Explosions
items.description: Experience with really fast dynamics modelling blast events in explicit finite element (Autodyn) carrying out my M.Sc. thesis.

items.title: Strength of Marine Structures
items.description: Modelling and reporting strength and dynamic response of ships to waves and propulsion both on commercial vessels and the worlds largest superyachts

items.title: Fatigue of Structures in Wave Loading)
items.description: Fatigue modelling is a requirement for structures in the O&G domain, and flexible pipes are complex structures to determine stress response of

items.title: In-field Measurement Campaigns
items.description: Carrying out noise and vibration measurements in difficult conditions all over the worlds using novel equipment, hereunder microphones hydrophones accelerometers strain gauges etc. and analyzing the results afterwards

items.description: well versed in the files system, permissions and user management. Furthermore, I (and the whole family) uses Linux for our devices at home
